summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Lawrence Visoski on July 9, 2019, commanding his appearance and testimony before the grand jury on July 29, 2019, and requiring him to produce all flight records and manifests related to airplanes owned or controlled by Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and transportation for illegal sexual activity.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.context: Commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce flight records related to Jeffrey Epstein's airplanes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation concerns airplanes owned, maintained, or controlled by him or his associated corporate entities.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued a grand jury subpoena to Visoski, compelling his testimony and document production.
Visoski is subpoenaed to produce records related to airplanes owned or controlled by Epstein, suggesting he may have had custody or knowledge of such records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance of Lawrence Visoski
events.description: Lawrence Visoski is commanded to appear before the federal grand jury in New York to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Lawrence Visoski as part of a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein for suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421-2423 (transportation for illegal sexual activity), and 371 (conspiracy) as of July 2019.

The subpoena specifically demands all flight records and manifests for airplanes owned, maintained, or controlled by Jeffrey Epstein or his corporate entities, indicating the investigation focused on air travel and passenger movements.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the subpoena recipient, Lawrence Visoski, to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document confirms the ongoing federal criminal investigation into Epstein was active and seeking testimony and evidence just weeks before his death in August 2019.
